The HH-87 Starhopper was released in 2013 and cost £
column2: 39.99. The set has the starhopper which is the main feature of the set and it also includes the 3 figures and a speeder. The speeder is small and has a relatively blocky, sloped-looking build. The front is clever and works well to demonstrate the shape of the speeder and is adjustable with simple bar hinges.

column1: The Starhopper has a very unique design in both in universe and indeed in the way that this model is designed. The interior is very primitive and has control panel
column2: with some lights around the sides&nbsp
column3: surrounding it as well as some suggestion for a seat. However, there is nothing more than this inside. These could be used to represent the weapons on the ship which are in the form of the 2 flick-fire missiles which have a simple firing system to launch remotely.

column1: Moreover the larger wings on the side can rotate between flight-mode and landing-mode. They only use ratcheted hinged hence can be easily put in place. However, the main feature which lifts the speeder into the rear hold of the ship which can be launched from beneath by a tiled button on top, which is an incredibly well-integrated system.
The 3 figures however are the stand-out part of the set. The Nikto guard has very simple yet effective armour detail and a simple vibro-axe which works well. The cad bane is also in a simple
column2: pattern which works for the figure as this was set when Cad Bane, Rako Hardeen and Morallo Eval (who isn&#39
column3: t included in the set). The highlight figure for me however is the Rako Hardeen which is decorated immaculately to how he looked in the story arc.
